AnalystsTest.Text:
5/28/2014 4:17:34 PM
Considering the present state of Indian economy, outline five key agendas for the newly formed Central Government.

The present rise in the stock market shows a sign of good times for the Indian economy with a positive hope to the business and the citizen of India, the key agendas of the government making India the self sufficient and economically strong country seems to be the one of the main agendas of NDA Government going to address, agriculture has to be the key concern of the government and some of the other agendas are:

Black money Issues : The first and the foremost action initiated and discussed by the cabinet on its first meeting, shows the interest and take on the black money issues to retrieve the hundreds of millions of rupees are saved in the banks overseas and to use in the betterment of the country.

Bilateral dialogue on Terrorism : The move made by the new Government is appreciated greatly by inviting the SAARC members and their presence projected a hope of friendly neighbourhood and uninterrupted economical transactions, to make a note of the vital counterpart of India - Pakistan has also has responded to the best to control the cross border terrorism as suggested by the Prime Minister of India Sri. Narendra Modi.

No to FDI in retail market: As India has the retail business' as their livelihood the unwelcoming of FDI in retail business in the interest of the largest Indian livelihood and to safeguard the common man's is a great take by the minister nirmala sitaraman of the NDA government.

Youth Empowerment : with the proven achievements as the Chief Minister for 3 consecutive terms Mr. Narendra modi might concentrate to nurture and encourage the youth of the country with focus on skills upgrade pertaining to develop Entrepreneurs and industry ready as India is one the largest country with highest youth population.

Agriculture has to be the key concern of the government
